Day 1: June 12 - Arrival & Beach Time

Morning (9:00 AM - Noon): Start your trip at Lanikai Beach, one of Oahu's most beautiful beaches. Perfect for swimming, kayaking, and relaxation. The turquoise waters and white sand make it ideal for photos. Duration: ~3 hours. More info

Afternoon (2:00 PM - 4:00 PM): Head to Kailua Town for lunch at Kalapawai Cafe & Deli. Try their famous sandwiches and local coffee. Explore the charming shops along Kailua Road. Visit website

Evening (6:00 PM): Dinner at Buzz's Original Steakhouse in Kailua. Fresh seafood and steaks with a local vibe. Reservations recommended.

Day 2: June 13 - Cultural Immersion

Morning (10:00 AM - 2:00 PM): Visit the Polynesian Cultural Center in Laie. Experience authentic villages representing Hawaii, Samoa, Fiji, Tahiti, Tonga, and Aotearoa. Don't miss the canoe pageant at 2:30 PM. Duration: 4-6 hours. Book tickets

Afternoon (3:00 PM): Stop at the nearby Hukilau Marketplace for shopping and snacks. Try local favorites like shave ice and poke bowls.

Evening (5:00 PM - 8:00 PM): Return to the Polynesian Cultural Center for their evening luau and "Ha: Breath of Life" show. Spectacular fire dancing and storytelling. (Included with premium admission)

Day 3: June 14 - Outdoor Adventure

Early Morning (7:00 AM - 11:00 AM): Take a Volcano Tour to explore Diamond Head Crater. The hike to the summit takes about 1.5 hours round trip and offers stunning 360Â° views of Waikiki and the Pacific. Bring water and sunscreen! Park details

Afternoon (1:00 PM): Lunch at Leonard's Bakery for their famous malasadas (Portuguese donuts). A local institution since 1952!

Late Afternoon (3:00 PM - Sunset): Relax at Waikiki Beach. Consider a sunset catamaran cruise or just enjoy the beach scene. Many operators offer 2-hour sunset sails with drinks included.
